message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.AI. 

The paper proposes a novel approach for collaborative filtering using graph convolutional networks to model user-item interactions. This falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and information retrieval (cs.IR). The approach also involves decomposing the edges in the user-item graph to identify latent components, which could be considered as a form of network analysis (cs.SI). Additionally, the use of sparse regularization and weighted random sampling could be seen as optimization techniques (cs.DS). Finally, the overall approach involves learning user preferences, which is a common theme in artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
